qas.question: During what years did the Avignon Papacy occur?
What is another term for the Avignon Papacy?
When did the Great Schism end?
How many popes existed simultaneously after the Council of Constance?

context: During the tumultuous 14th century, disputes within the leadership of the Church led to the Avignon Papacy of <a0_0>1305–78<a0_0/>, also called the "<a1_0>Babylonian Captivity of the Papacy<a1_0/>" (a reference to the Babylonian captivity of the Jews), and then to the Great Schism, lasting from 1378 to <a2_0>1418<a2_0/>, when there were two and later three rival popes, each supported by several states. Ecclesiastical officials convened at the Council of Constance in 1414, and in the following year the council deposed one of the rival popes, leaving only <a3_0>two<a3_0/> claimants. Further depositions followed, and in November 1417 the council elected <a4_0>Martin V<a4_0/> (pope 1417–31) as pope.
